name: Advanced Moving Target Double Kettlebell Complex
description: An advanced double kettlebell complex that flows through swings, cleans, and snatches with a decreasing ladder for snatch reps (3-2-1) across rounds. The 'moving target' refers to the descending snatch count. All performed without setting the bells down.

exercises.name: Double Kettlebell Swing
exercises.description: Hinge at the hips to swing two kettlebells from between the legs to chest height using explosive hip drive.
exercises.notes: Maintain neutral spine; power from hips, not arms.

exercises.name: Double Kettlebell Clean
exercises.description: Pull the kettlebells from the swing position into a racked position at the chest, elbows tucked.
exercises.notes: Keep bells close to body; use legs and hips to guide the movement.

exercises.name: Double Kettlebell Snatch
exercises.description: From the racked position, explosively press the kettlebells overhead in one motion, locking out arms.
exercises.notes: Punch through the bells; maintain tension in core and glutes. Reps: 3 in round 1, 2 in round 2, 1 in round 3.

sequence.flow: Exercises flow together without setting bells down. Swing into clean into snatch.
sequence.notes: Moving target = snatch reps decrease each round: 3-2-1. Swing and clean reps not specified, flow continuously into snatches.

raw.caption:
Advanced Double Bell Complex

Thanks to @alexkaru on IG for sharing
raw.visualSummary: Performer executes double kettlebell swings, cleans, and snatches in a continuous flow outdoors on grass, repeating the sequence three times with decreasing snatch repetitions indicated by overlays and green ball counters.

uncertainties: Exact reps for swings and cleans not stated - they flow into snatches per round
No spoken audio; structure based solely on visuals and text overlays
Workout duration estimated; actual time depends on reps chosen for swings and cleans
